entries.content: Objections are information requests, not rejections.
entries.notes: Reframing objections as opportunities to gather more information rather than seeing them as barriers.

entries.content: Ask questions to uncover the real reasons behind objections.
entries.notes: Encourages deeper engagement and understanding of the prospect's needs.

entries.content: Selling is about disqualifying, not qualifying.
entries.notes: Focus on identifying reasons not to work together to streamline the sales process.

entries.content: I'll be upfront, it's a sales call. You can hang up or give me 30 seconds.
entries.notes: Direct approach that sets clear expectations and respects the prospect's time.

entries.content: Prospect says no to a meeting, salesperson asks one last question to verify if it's a real no.
entries.notes: Demonstrates persistence without being pushy, ensuring no opportunity is missed.

entries.content: People buy emotionally and justify intellectually.
entries.notes: Understanding the emotional drivers behind purchases to tailor the sales approach.

entries.content: Identify symptoms your product fixes and ask if the prospect recognizes them.
entries.notes: Helps prospects self-identify needs without direct selling.

focus_area: Objection Mindset: Objections = info requests, not rejections
